intro: Stenorrhynchos oestrifer, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and thrives in well-draining soil. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Stenorrhynchos oestrifer is popular for its ease of care and ability to bloom throughout the year under proper conditions.
